FeedItems.Title: Deprecating packages on nuget.org
FeedItems.Summary: We are excited to announce that nuget.org now supports package deprecation. This has been a long standing ask that will help the ecosystem use supported packages. As a package publisher on nuget.org,...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dev branch of NuGetGallery is not emitting request or dependency telemetry in AI" (#7773) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
customMetrics
| where timestamp > ago(7d)
| extend cloudDeploymentId = tostring(customDimensions.CloudDeploymentId)
| where isnotempty(cloudDeploymentId)
| summarize count() by bin(timestamp, 3h), cloudDeploymentId
| render columnchart 

## requests

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/70948780-1067ea80-2011-11ea-98e5-5f7210427723.png)

## dependencies

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/70948796-1b227f80-2011-11ea-8f01-59d2668cb9a2.png)

## traces

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/70948811-207fca00-2011-11ea-8a5e-694240189135.png)

## customMetrics

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/70948822-25447e00-2011-11ea-9179-45bb19bd21e6.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "A/B test prefix matching on nuget.org" (#7764) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
⚠️ Do not copy this issue! This used a special A/B test process. For correct instructions, follow this process in the OneNote: [Rebuild the Azure Search Index](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FNuGet%2FTeam%2FNugetServer%2FNugetServerTeamNote&wd=target%28Operations.one%7CC674B49C-4CB7-4793-8890-A1E46E33FEB9%2FRebuild%20the%20Azure%20Search%20Index%7CC705999F-85D9-4A93-8CFB-161C393C56FE%2F%29).

1. Determine the live instance of the Azure Search jobs
    - [ ] "a"
    - [x] "b"
    - [ ] "c"
1. ~~Determine the new instance to be used~~
    - [ ] "a"
    - [x] "b"
    - [ ] "c"
1. Update the job and service configuration
    - [ ] ~~NuGetDeployment PR:~~
    - [ ] ~~Infrastructure build:~~
    - [ ] ~~NuGet.Jobs Config build:~~
    - [x] AzureSearchService build: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3385062
1. ~~Deploy Azure Search infrastructure to provision the resources and secrets~~
1. ~~Deploy Db2AzureSearch to initialize the new indexes~~
1. ~~Deploy alternative instances of the Azure Search jobs~~
1. ~~Monitor the new Catalog2AzureSearch cursors~~
1. ~~Deploy V3 monitoring to start monitoring the new indexes. If you are not rebuilding for an A/B test all this really will do is add an additional cursor to wait on.~~
1. Deploy AzureSearchService
    - ⚠️ The Azure Search Service must be deployed after all other jobs.
    - Release: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=552548
    - DEV
       - [x] USNC
       - [x] USSC
       - [x] EA
       - [x] SEA
    - INT
       - [x] USNC
       - [x] USSC
    - PROD
       - [ ] USNC
       - [ ] USSC
       - [ ] EA
       - [ ] SEA
1. ~~Change the default Instance name for job release pipelines~~
1. Wait a week.
1. ~~Clean up~~
   - ~~Stop monitoring the old cursors~~
   - ~~Stop monitoring the old indexes by deploying V3 monitoring~~
   - ~~Stop old job instances~~
   - ~~Update the [Secret Rotation excel](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/Team/Engineering/NuGet_Secret_Rototation_Status.xlsx?web=1) to make sure new secrets are there and old secrets are gone~~

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget restore succeed but project .net don't have content css and js" (#9071) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

From Azure Pipeline restore package succeed, but the content (css,js ,img) of package is not added in Web application .net

In the case of Visual Studio i must install package again.

Thanks if your help.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Ensure that ResumeVSInstall is running latest VS_Installer.exe" (#9105) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: @zivkan's recent addition of ResumeVSInstall https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/90f0a2cc44df67ca01d6411fd68e5aac57e2a247 also needs to make sure that it installs the latest VS_Installer.exe (via downloading and executing the latest VSBootstrapper)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Visual Studio 2017 Package Restore Fails If Build Forced "Too Early" (Race Condition?)" (#9049) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: VS UI

VS version: Visual Studio 2017 15.9.14

OS version: Windows Server 2012 R2

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

In some scenarios not quite understood yet it appears that NuGet will fail to load properly in Visual Studio. Our best guess is this happens when loading larger solutions (anything with more than 50 projects, with more projects being more likely to occur).

When this happens opening up Package Manager Console in this manner and then rebuilding allows NuGet to restore the packages.

![FixNuGetInitalizationError](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592881/72189833-2459fe80-33bb-11ea-8b3f-a84fb9c2cf26.gif)

## Other suggested things
Searching the open and closed issues for anything about race conditions shows some promising items; the closest that seems related might be https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8881 but it is unclear.

Is there any logs we can grab to help troubleshoot this when we do see it occur? For now we apply the work around and that always seems to work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Issues posted here with over 100 positive reactions and supporting comments are being ignored" (#9047) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Community feedback regarding a problem or feature isnt going to get much louder than that.  Why is the Nuget team not listening?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotNet Core SDK 3.1.100 failing to restore because of bad versions" (#9051) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @predatorian3 on Saturday, January 11, 2020 1:53:54 AM_

# Issue Description

On a brand new install of dotNet Core SDK 3.1.100 for Windows 10 x64, It seems to be missing dependencies with the install. Should I need to include other feeds to get the `dotnet restore` to work after doing a `dotnet new xunit`? I was following this document: [Organizing and testing projects with the .NET Core command line](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tutorials/testing-with-cli#testing-the-sample). Some of the references are a little old so maybe something changed? 

## Steps performed

```
dotnet new xunit
dotnet restore
```

## System Information

```
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests>systeminfo

Host Name:                 FENIX
OS Name:                   Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
OS Version:                10.0.18362 N/A Build 18362
OS Manufacturer:           Microsoft Corporation
```

## `dotnet` Errors
```
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests>dotnet restore 
Restore completed in 25.54 ms for C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\src\NewTypes\NewTypes.csproj.
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests\NewTypesTests.csproj : error NU1100: Unable to resolve 'Microsoft.NET.Test.Sdk (>= 16.2.0)' for '.NETCoreApp,Version=v3.1'.
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests\NewTypesTests.csproj : error NU1100: Unable to resolve 'xunit (>= 2.4.0)' for '.NETCoreApp,Version=v3.1'.
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests\NewTypesTests.csproj : error NU1100: Unable to resolve 'xunit.runner.visualstudio (>= 2.4.0)' for '.NETCoreApp,Version=v3.1'.
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests\NewTypesTests.csproj : error NU1100: Unable to resolve 'coverlet.collector (>= 1.0.1)' for '.NETCoreApp,Version=v3.1'.
  Restore failed in 150.83 ms for C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests\NewTypesTests.csproj.
```

## `dotnet` information

```
C:\Users\Phillip\Desktop\dotNetCore\01_NewTypes\test\NewTypesTests>dotnet --info
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.1.100
 Commit:    cd82f021f4

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.18362
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.100\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 3.1.0
  Commit:  65f04fb6db

.NET Core SDKs installed:
  3.1.100 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

.NET Core runtimes installed:
  Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App]
  Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
  Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

To install additional .NET Core runtimes or SDKs:
  https://aka.ms/dotnet-download
```

_Copied from original issue: dotnet/sdk#4156_
